subtitle: if you're asked
do you matter do you truly matter
so initially most of us would shrug it
off
laugh it off yeah of course i matter
i have a healthy ego i feel important i
have people who love me
here i have plaques on my wall different
accomplishments
but let me rephrase it
would the world be any different if you
didn't exist
remember before you were born nobody was
expecting you
so it's not like you're filling some
position
are you fundamentally indispensable
would the world be different if you did
not exist
once we're here we justify our existence
and very
very often in good ways but if you were
not here
would anything be missing and there
people start pausing and saying one
second maybe not
maybe i don't matter that much among
seven and a half billion people
what significance is one human being
and somebody even say no i don't matter
on that level on a cosmic level on a
circumstantial level i matter to the
people who know me the people i've
contributed to
the answer is you absolutely matter you
are indispensable
not because you're a great person not
because you have qualities and virtues
and skills
and because people love you and they
tell you you're important because
the divine creator the cosmic engineer
put you here a vote of confidence in you
i've given you a mission that you and
only you can accomplish
so why do lives matter because of that
divine component
do we see ourselves in that way very
often we value
especially in our society how is
somebody valued
what are the criteria good looks youth
energy productivity equity social status
power influence money
a whole list of items
that we identify with success
but all those things are arbitrary
they're good to have you matter
not because of any of those items
because all of them are
temporary they're all impermanent you
matter fundamentally and essentially
because you were put here for a purpose
it was sent on a mission you're an
ambassador
a divine ambassador an agent of light
of inspiration of beauty and love
if you saw yourself that way 24 7 you
looked at others that way
what would it do to the landscape of our
society
so yes we need short-term solutions to
violence
to crime no matter what direction it's
coming from but in the big picture
this is the perspective we need to
revisit
and re-plug
you
